classes

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.User
      • classes.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Client
extends User
implements java.util.Observer
    This class represents the clients of the restaurant. It contains all the information needed for logging in, but also information on how the restaurant will interact with him/her (type of fidelity card, contact information, ...). The methods that aren't documented are the classic getters and setters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String surName, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password)
      This is the default constructor, the user will have a Basic Fidelity Card and he agrees to all kind of notification.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String firstName,
      java.lang.String surName,
      java.lang.String userName,
      java.lang.String password)
        This is the default constructor, the user will have a Basic Fidelity Card and he agrees to all kind of notification.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of the user.
        surName - The surname of the user.
        userName - The username of the user. In order to register, the username selected must be different from all the other usernames.
        password - The password of the user.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • getAgreement

        public java.lang.Boolean getAgreement(java.lang.String offerType)
        Replaces the getter, which is less relevant here.
        Parameters:
        offerType - Usually "BirthdayOffer" or "SpecialOffer"
        Returns:
        true or false depending on the choice of the user to receive or not to receive a notification related to the offer.

      • setAgreement

        public void setAgreement(java.lang.String offerType,
                java.lang.Boolean agreement)
        Replaces the setter, which is less relevant here
        Parameters:
        offerType - Usually "BirthdayOffer" or "SpecialOffer"
        agreement - Agreement to receive notification related to the offer.

      • getContactInfo

        public java.lang.String getContactInfo(java.lang.String type)
        Replaces the getter, which is less relevant here
        Parameters:
        type - Usually "email" or "phone"
        Returns:
        the contact information of the type asked or null if the value doesn't exist

      • setContactInfo

        public void setContactInfo(java.lang.String contactType,
                  java.lang.String contact)
        Replaces the setter, which is less relevant here. Only one contact information is possible for a type of contact (only one email for example). If a value for the given type exists, it will be replaced by the new one.
        Parameters:
        offerType - Usually "BirthdayOffer" or "SpecialOffer"
        agreement - Agreement to receive notification related to the offer.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
          java.lang.Object arg)
        This method handles the notification a client can get. For each kind of notification, there is a message that is written on the client's notification wall.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
